revised_title: Temperature Dependence of Torsional Rigidity and Internal Friction in Quartz Fibers
tldr: The author investigates the effects of temperature on the torsional rigidity and internal friction of quartz fibers, finding that the rigidity increases linearly with temperature and the internal friction remains constant within a certain range. The study also reveals that quartz fibers become more rigid over time, likely due to annealing.
